name: unpleasantness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of not being enjoyable or pleasant: The cold, raw temperatures of late January only added to the general unpleasantness of the climate. I wanted, foolishly, to protect you from the unpleasantnesses of life.
the quality of being rude and angry: She'd had enough of Louisa's constant unpleasantness. It might be better to leave before there was open unpleasantness. See
unpleasant
More examplesFewer examplesLights must be positioned carefully to avoid the unpleasantness of a bright light shining into your eyes.The industry's ageing jets contribute to the general unpleasantness of air travel these days. Both players were taken off to avoid any further unpleasantness.
